intro: Phymatodes engleri, commonly known as the Engler's phymatode, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
